text: Hello everyone, I again welcome you all to the course on fuzzy logic inference and machine learning techniques. I am Dr. Aftab Ahmed Ansari, your instructor for this course. So today is our lecture number eight. In previous lecture, we have covered about the different types of fuzzification techniques and different types of defuzzification techniques in the previous lecture. We have already covered. So if I will give you a brief recap of the fuzzy logic controller, so you can see that this is the basic block diagram, basic block diagram of the fuzzy logic controller in which up to this lecture, we have covered this fuzzification technique, which is a component of the fuzzy logic controller in which we will convert the crisp input to the fuzzy input and we have seen different types of method for that fuzzification and then defuzzification we have also covered in the previous lecture and its different types of method we have also seen in the previous lecture. Defuzzification technique is a method in which we will convert the fuzzy input to the crisp output basically. Okay, and this is the complete block diagram of the fuzzy logic controller. So basically we know that there are four main components of the fuzzy logic controller. First one is the fuzzification, which we have covered. Second one is the rule base. Third one is the interference engine. That too we have to covered in this lecture or in the upcoming lecture, we will try to cover these both methods and fourth one is the defuzzification method. Again we have covered that method in the previous lecture and we have also seen different types of methods to convert that fuzzy to the crisp output. Okay, so we will talk about the fuzzy rule based system that is also known as the in short I have written there FRBS in full form I have written in the next slide. So no issue. Now if I will give you the brief recap in previous lecture we have covered the fuzzification methods and defuzzification method. In defuzzification method several methods are there lambda cut method, centroid method, weighted average method, maxima method that all are the methods we have covered in the previous lecture. In this lecture we will try to focus on the fuzzy rule based system. Now what is the fuzzy rule based system? Basically fuzzy rule based system is the heart of the fuzzy logic controller we can say that because it is a system which uses the fuzzy rule to process the imprecise input and produce the output means whatever input we have given to the fuzzy logic controller what it will process it with the help of some rule and then produce the output on the basis of that certain rules and the input. It will take the input and match with the rule base that rule we will see in this lecture also what that rule base means and then it will produce the output on the basis of that rules and inputs. So basically it will we can say that it will mimics like a human reasoning method which comes or which we will use in the under the case of the uncertainty when we are not able to decide the output on the basis of 0 and 1. For that cases we are using that fuzzy logic controller and the knowledge base consists of two systems, two components that is rules and the membership function. Membership function also we have studied in the first and second lecture different types of membership function we have already seen in the previous lecture that is lecture number 1 and 2 you can see that. Now the component of the fuzzy rule base system FRBS means fuzzy rule base systems I will choose the marker for that FRBS means fuzzy rule base system that is the full form of FRBS. Now FRBS consists of two knowledge base and interference engine and then knowledge base consists of two things that is the fuzzy rules. Fuzzy rules is basically a structure in which we will write the rules for the fuzzy logic controller it is basically if else type of rules are there if and then if whatever the condition then what will be the action on the basis of that condition then action. Its structure is like if condition then action on the basis of that condition. If we will see the example which I have written in the slide that if temperature is high then fan speed is fast. If condition like what is the condition if temperature is high then action what is the action then fan speed should be fast that type of rules we will write in the knowledge base and second one is the membership function. Membership function means whatever we are giving input to the fuzzy logic controller we will convert that input that crisp input to the fuzzy output we will match basically whatever our input there we will match with the fuzzy membership function. Different types of fuzzy membership functions are there like triangular means that type of fuzzy membership function is there triangular membership function one trapezoidal type is there. So, we will match our input to the fuzzy membership functions and then is interference engine it is basically evaluate the rules and combine the output whatever rules we have written it on the basis of that input it evaluates all the rule and then combines or combines the output for each rule. It will check how many rules is activated on the base of that rules and whatever the what is the whatever will be the output for each rules it will check which rules is activated if multiple rules are activated then it will combine its output and aggregate it. Then the last step is defuzzification then whatever the output we will get after aggregation we will convert that output to the crisp output with the help of defuzzification. Now, this is basically the fuzzy rule structure if we will see this is basically the syntax for that what the syntax if antecedent it means the if the condition whatever your condition then on the basis of that condition action which we also known as consequent and it means condition whatever condition whatever condition we are giving on the basis of that input then it will produce the action on the basis of that condition like for example, if we see if we have temperature is high and humidity is high then fan speed should be fast. So, if you can see that if temperature is high if temperature is high and humidity is humid then fan speed should be fast. So, it will it is the basically rule one we can say and multiple this type of rules we can say that if temperature is low and humidity is low then fan speed should be low that type of rules we can write in the fuzzy rule base system then antecedents means the input condition whatever you are giving of as a input and what is the condition for that like for this example if you can see our input is temperature now on the basis of that input we have write we have write certain rules like if temperature is high humidity is humid then fan speed is fast you can see that we are having two input for that for that fuzzy logic system if we can say that we are taking temperature as one input and humidity as second input.
